alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 6:11PM EDT until April 22 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Northwestern Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Central Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 610 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Skytop to Old Orchard, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Easton, Newton, Montague, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Forks, East Stroudsburg, Wilson, Washington, Blairstown, Hellertown, Nazareth, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha and Hope. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 68 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 300 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 21. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
